questions: To greet my neighbor, I told him ____.
imgPages: You wave when you say hello.
hello.lessonquestion: When would you say hello to someone?
answers: When you see them in the morning
When they go to the store
explanations: You say hello when you first see a person.
You don't say hello when a person is leaving.

questions: I love it when Sam's ____ barks at me!
dog.lessonquestion: What sound does a dog make?
explanations: Woof is a sound a dog can make.
A dog mostly woofs or barks.

questions: Max's ___ purrs when they are happy.
cat.lessonquestion: What sound does a cat make
explanations: Meow is a sound a cat can make.
A car mostly meows or purrs.

questions: We kept in ___ with Aunt Clara.
Add a ___ of salt to the mix.
Don't ___ the stray cat!
Don't ___ the hot stove!
imgPages: You touch and feel things with your hands, like a dog.
To 'keep in touch' means to talk and catch up with someone regularly, even if they're far.
A touch is also a little bit of something, like salt.
touch.lessonquestion: What don't you want to touch?
explanations: It would hurt to touch a fire.
These are very nice to touch.

questions: I'm interested. Please ___.
answers: When you use your mouth to make words
explanations: You use your mouth to talk.
You don't use your hands, arms, or legs to talk.

questions: I ___ in my books every day.
He opened the envelope and ___ the note.
Sometimes I think my mom can ___ my mind.
Did you ___ the news today?
Claire searched his face, trying to ___ him.
imgPages: Reading a person's face or mind is trying to figure out what they're feeling.
read.lessonquestion: Where would you read a book?
explanations: The library is the best place to read a book.
You'd be too busy to read a book.

questions: Just ___ to what they have to say.
She would not ___ to her parents.
To ___ to music can be relaxing.
Try to ___ to her advice.
He wanted to ___ to his own heartbeat.
imgPages: Listening to someone also means following their directions.
listen.lessonquestion: When would it be important to listen?
explanations: Teachers say things for you to listen.
When no one is talking you might not need to listen.

questions: This looks like a good spot to ___ lunch.
explanations: Sandwiches are tasty.
There are some things you cannot eat.

questions: Relief brought a ___ to her lips.
explanations: You smile when you're happy
Other faces have other emotions.

questions: Lisa did the best she could to ___ a map on the small piece of paper.
imgPages: You can draw a picture with a pencil.
Drawing can also mean to bring something out, like drawing a sword.
explanations: Besides a pencil, you can draw with many other things.
You can't draw with everyday items.

questions: Let's go ___ at the horses.
look.lessonquestion: What do you use to look?
explanations: Eyes are for looking
These are for moving and touching

questions: She wanted to scream, ___, or flee.
cry.lessonquestion: When would you want to cry?
answers: If you do good on a test
explanations: When bad things happen, it's ok to cry.
Most of the time, people don't cry

questions: He loved poetry and soon began to ___ poems of his own.
imgPages: Lots of people write in journals.
explanations: You can only write words.
You can write words and other things

questions: I went to ___ last night, almost as soon as my head hit the pillow.
sleep.lessonquestion: What time would you want to sleep?
explanations: If it's late you should go sleep.
You shouldn't sleep in the middle of the day.

questions: The ___ was dark and damp.
imgPages: Sometimes you can see stars at night.
answers: The time when it's dark outside
The time when you play outside in the sunshine.
The time when you eat breakfast
When you get picked up by the school bus
explanations: Nights are dark.
Night is the opposite of day.

questions: It was midsummer, and the ___ was very hot
day.lessonquestion: What can you see during the day?
explanations: The sun comes up during the day
These things come at night.

questions: No place is better than ___ on Christmas.
imgPages: Home can be a house, but it doesn't have to be.
answers: Where you live with your family
Where you sit with your friends
explanations: Home is where your family is.
These other places are not home.

questions: My ___ includes my father and mother, two older brothers, and a little sister, Mildred.
imgPages: A family is who you grow up with.
family.lessonquestion: When would you be with your family?
explanations: Most of the time, you're at home with your family
There are some times when you're not with your family
